com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface checkOrderTransactionComplete

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface checkOrderTransactionComplete

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document checkOrderTransactionComplete(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      This API is used to check for any pending items that need to be resolved before marking the Customer Transaction for an Order as complete.

    • Method Detail

      • checkOrderTransactionComplete

        org.w3c.dom.Document checkOrderTransactionComplete(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                   java.rmi.RemoteException

        This API is used to check for any pending items that need to be resolved before marking the Customer Transaction for an Order as complete. This API will check for various impediments like Active HOLDs, Pending Payment totals and any additional processes that need to be resolved. This API will be primarily used in a Point Of Sale system where the cashier needs to know when the customer interaction can be marked as complete so that the customer can leave the store. This API will ensure that Payment Processing is complete, Holds are resolved, and any additional processes like Gift Card activation , registration are complete before marking the Order transaction as complete.
        This API can be extended to use in Other channels like Call Center in future. A filter (InPerson) flag has been provided in the API input to check for completion impediments that are specific to a channel. Currently InPerson will indicate if the transaction is in store or not, InPerson = Y indicates it is a store transaction.
        Holds: If the flag InPerson is passed as 'Y', this API will check for preventive Hold Types for the the transaction IN_PERSON_ORDER_TRANSACTION_COMPLETE. This transaction is specific to in Store processing. The API returns a flag ActiveHoldsExist to indicate if Holds exist or not.
        Payment Processing: This API checks for all remaining payment totals for the order - Remaining Amount to Charge, Remaining Amount to Auth and Remaining Amount to Refund. If these totals are zero, the API returns the flag PaymentProcessingComplete as 'Y'. The totals are made available on the Order details XML and are filtered by InPerson flag. Based on the input InPerson filter, totals specific to that filter value will be evaluated and PaymentProcessingComplete flag is returned accordingly.
        Additional Impediments: Certain Items when bought need activation/registration. This process is generally done after Payment Processing is complete. There should be a way to ensure that all activations or any other additional processing required for the Order is complete. This API invokes the extension point OMP_GET_ADDITIONAL_COMPLETION_IMPEDIMENTS_FOR_ORDER to get all additional impediments for the Order. This extension point should be custom implemented and it should return all impediments that need to be resolved before Order Transaction can be marked as complete. This API returns the flag AdditionalCompletionImpediments to indicate if there are any additional impediments for the Order Transaction as returned by the extension point implementation.
        If all the above mentioned impediments are resolved then the summary flag OrderTransactionComplete is returned as 'Y'. This API also returns Order Details in the output document. The output document is template controlled.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None
        Events Raised: None
        Audits: No.

        Pre-conditions:
        None

        Post-conditions:
        None

        Output Template Support: Yes.

        Database Extensibility Support: No.

        Parameters:
        env - Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is a mandatory parameter.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the completion Impediments and Order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output xml files.

        Throws:
        YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.


        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
